Author: pbca26#5430
Content:
agama doesn't support an extra passphrase for bip39 seeds nor it can login with bip39 seed
settings -> bip39 is similar to https://iancoleman.io/bip39/ tool, only good to obtain priv keys
if you're trying to access any substantial funds i'd strongly recommend to avoid using hot wallets

Author: Arno#3334
Content: Hi, I have a question regarding the claiming of the active user rewards: Is there kind of a "special" transaction necessary to claim the accrued rewards (i.e. a wallet feature), or is it simply a regular transaction of the max funds to the same address that you're sending from, and in that case automatically claimed?

Author: Arno#3334
Content: I mean, does the process of claiming has to be "triggered" by the wallet somehow, or is it being done automatically?

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: claiming is basically sending the funds to yourself to the same address, if you send to another address, the reward will be added to the first address.

Author: Arno#3334
Content: So I could use the magnumwallet (which doesn't explicitly support or feature a "claiming" option) along with the Trezor hardware wallet, and simply send the max funds to my same address, and this will automatically send me the accrued rewards on top of the sent balance?

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: correct

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: in magnum there is a claim button btw

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: https://medium.com/@Magnum_Wallet/how-to-claim-your-komodo-kmd-rewards-in-magnum-wallet-64ade7b9e

Author: Arno#3334
Content: (I'm asking for the ideal scenario for Trezor wallet including reward claiming)

Author: Arno#3334
Content: Thanks, I'll try that as soon as there are some rewards to be claimed.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: ummmmmmmm

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: I am not sure if it works with Trezos, it does with Ledger

Author: Arno#3334
Content: Yes, that's the big question.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: Not all 3rd party wallets set locktime, and as a result, you may not accrue rewards ...

Author: Arno#3334
Content: So far, the button "claim rewards" is greyed out here, but it may be due to insufficient rewards.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: If that's what you were asking

Author: Arno#3334
Content: I'll collect some, and then will try it.

Author: Arno#3334
Content: But Trezor does set the locktime, that's what I've found out so far.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: Then it should be okay. That's the only "technical" implication behind it.

Author: Arno#3334
Content: ok

Author: Arno#3334
Content: That's why I was asking about the "regular" transaction to oneself versus a special "claim" triggering option.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: the claim itself isn't "triggered" but the UTXO has to have locktime set when received.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@Arno you can check if your address is generating rewards or not: <https://www.atomicexplorer.com/#/rewards>
> That's why I was asking about the "regular" transaction to oneself versus a special "claim" triggering option

it is just a regular transaction to your self. but, the wallet has to be aware that it can send more than there are available coins and send them. i.e., the fee is negative
komodo daemon(node) and agama wallet, ocean qt wallet, all do it 

 as shown in that blog post, magnum seems to support claiming rewards but I am not 100% sure if magnum with trezor can do it
the best solution is directly ask the magnum guys <https://discordapp.com/invite/GZPngxY>

Author: Arno#3334
Content: @gcharang Thanks for the info. I've tried again and compared it to magnumwallet's own internal KMD addresses: with those it is possible to claim rewards, but with the addresses linked to Trezor, the claim feature is simply missing from the menu. I've spoken to the magnumwallet support and they've confirmed this. There is still no good reason in my view to have this feature disabled for Trezor-linked wallets since the only requirement is the locktime, which trezor actually supports. It seems to me more like that a developer has simply put a condition like "if trezor, then remove claim feature" even though it would perfectly work.

Author: Arno#3334
Content: So I'm still looking for the ideal KMD wallet connected to Trezor that actually supports the rewards claiming. Your mentioned wallets that support the claiming all do not seem to work with Trezor, do they?

Author: Arno#3334
Content: (komodo daemon, agama wallet, ocean qt wallet)

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@Arno
> since the only requirement is the locktime
locktime exists in most of the bitcoin forks; but the reward claiming is unique to KMD and as far as I know it is not implemented in trezor hw yet
> It seems to me more like that a developer has simply put a condition like "if trezor, then remove claim feature" even though it would perfectly work
this is not true. in a hardware wallet like trezor, transaction signing and validation is done on the hw itself;
to support KMD rewards, the trezor formware itself needs to be updated (to allow sending of "more" coins than already exist)
I think it is currently in development
once it gets added to Trezor, any of the third party wallets (like magnum) will be able to enable reward claim with trezor
